comments: Dargan is a fantastic poet with a lot of experience in the field, but he can be quiet (humble?) at passing that on as a teacher. His approach is more about "open support" than it is about "whipping you into shape," which has its pros and cons. Workshop discussion can be lackluster since proof that you critiqued your peers\' work isn\'t required.
Professor Dargan is a decent professor. He is very knowledgeable in the field and a great writer. His class is very easy and the assignments are fun.
Great workshop leader and poet but you have to seek out his poetry, he won\'t make you read it. Very shy and quiet.

may I start from the fact that this is one Handsome teacher. If that doesn\'t motivate you enough to be on your best behaviour in class and work hard, here\'s more. He\'s patient, very encouraging, isn\'t that annoying art and poetry lover that wants to force it on you , or change your life or be partial towards those that are like that.
The comment below is for Creative Writing: Poetry (Lit 402 or something like that).

Well spoken, well dressed and knows his stuff. His workshop based class is always lively and helpful- his input and classmates\' input really helps revise your poems and exposes you to different poetry styles. Really enjoyed this class!
Where do I begin? His man is fine. [and single] and well dressed. the list goes on from there. he\'ll make you appreciate poetry if you know what i mean. :]

I took him for The Literary Imagination. It was my best class of the semester, and I would DEF take him again. He\'s friendly, easy to understand, but still makes the class a challenge. Takes reading quizzes to make sure you read the book, but otherwise AWESOME.
